It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, herbaceous stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
